title: How to Replace the Top and Bottom Spray Arm Seals

steps.headline: Throw out the old spray arm, put the new one over top, and reinstall the arm and the retaining nut.
Slide the lower dish rack back into place.
Take out the upper dish rack so it can be laid on a flat surface.
To remove the rack remove the two rack stops using a flat blade screwdriver.
steps.description: Depress the tab and lift up on them. Do the same for the other side.

steps.headline: Slide the upper rack forward, off the tracks and push the two racks that will stick out back inside.
Set the rack with the arm facing up, on top of the dishwasher or counter to do the repair.
Remove the Phillips screw that connects the supply tube to the mount.
steps.description: Lift off the supply tube and put it aside. The seal that needs to be replaced is on the bottom of the upper spray arm.

steps.headline: Put the new seal into place and line up the supply tube.
steps.description: Make sure it’s flush on the mount and re-insert the one screw. We’re ready to reassemble.Tip: Don’t over tighten the screw.

steps.headline: Reinstall the rack.
steps.description: Pull the tracks forward and line them up with the racks wheels. Begin with the front wheels and push the rack along the tracks. Now reinstall the rack stops. Make sure the bendable tab is on top and stick the bottom of the tab in first, press it into place until it locks.

steps.headline: You’ve just repaired the top and bottom spray arm seals in your dishwasher!

text: Bottom Spray Arm Throw out the old spray arm, put the new one over top, and reinstall the arm and the retaining nut.  Slide the lower dish rack back into place.  Top Spray Arm Take out the upper dish rack so it can be laid on a flat surface.  To remove the rack remove the two rack stops using a flat blade screwdriver. Depress the tab and lift up on them. Do the same for the other side. Slide the upper rack forward, off the tracks and push the two racks that will stick out back inside.  Set the rack with the arm facing up, on top of the dishwasher or counter to do the repair.  Remove the Phillips screw that connects the supply tube to the mount. Lift off the supply tube and put it aside. The seal that needs to be replaced is on the bottom of the upper spray arm. Put the new seal into place and line up the supply tube. Make sure it’s flush on the mount and re-insert the one screw. We’re ready to reassemble.Tip: Don’t over tighten the screw. Reinstall the rack. Pull the tracks forward and line them up with the racks wheels. Begin with the front wheels and push the rack along the tracks. Now reinstall the rack stops. Make sure the bendable tab is on top and stick the bottom of the tab in first, press it into place until it locks. You’ve just repaired the top and bottom spray arm seals in your dishwasher!
